  • Method Details

    • checkForCollisions

      public boolean checkForCollisions​(Entity[][] entity, int x, int y)
      The checkForCollisions method.
      Parameters:
      entity - the bidimensional array that contains the entity
      x - the entity's x
      y - the entity's y
      Returns:
      a boolean that indicates if there is a collision or not.

    • checkForDiamonds

      public boolean checkForDiamonds​(Entity[][] playerPosition, int x, int y)
      The checkForDiamonds method.
      Parameters:
      playerPosition - the player
      x - the player's x
      y - the player's y
      Returns:
      a boolean that indicates if the player is going on a diamond.

    • checkForPlayer

      public boolean checkForPlayer​(Entity[][] entity, int x, int y)
      The checkForPlayer method.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity that is gonna kill or no the player
      x - the entity's x
      y - the entity's y
      Returns:
      a boolean that indicates if there is a player near the entity.

    • checkForPath

      public boolean checkForPath​(Entity[][] entity, int x, int y)
      The checkForPath method.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity
      x - the entity's x
      y - the entity's y
      Returns:
      a boolean that indicates if there is a path near the entity. If true, it can moves.

    • checkForStoneToMove

      public boolean checkForStoneToMove​(Entity[][] entity, int x, int y, int sideX)
      The checkForStoneToMove method.
      Parameters:
      entity - the player
      x - the player's x
      y - the player's y
      sideX - the side on which the player wants to move the stone (left/right)
      Returns:
      a boolean that indicates if the player can move a stone on the side he wants.
